title: Dev Griffin's shock Strictly exit doesn't prove the show is racist – but black contestants deserve better
text:
It’s that time of year again. With each autumn, along with the falling of leaves and the drawing in of nights, comes the annual occurrence of a racism scandal on Strictly Come Dancing.

Sunday evening’s results show saw the surprise knockout of Radio 1 DJ Dev Griffin. The 34-year-old East Londoner with a topknot came into the ballroom contest’s fourth weekend as the third highest-scoring celebrity so far. He was a 22/1 long shot to be eliminated and hotly tipped as a potential finalist.

Only last week, he scored a clean sweep of nines for his superb Aladdin-themed streetdance and finished second on the leaderboard. Dev certainly didn’t seem like elimination fodder.

On Saturday evening, however,...
description: It’s that time of year again.
